synthetic_data_notice: This dataset is fully synthetic and designed for product/demo/testing use only. Names, contacts, events, and message contents are fabricated but patterned after realistic enrollment inquiry behavior.
institution_context: SNHU-style enrollment triage demo (online + campus admissions context; tone emphasizes supportive, human-guided next steps for working adults, families, transfer, military, and international learners).

notes: Based on public SNHU admissions/contact pages and common higher-ed enrollment channels (email, RFI forms, chat, phone, SMS after consent).
WhatsApp/social DM are included as plausible omnichannel extensions for international and re-engagement workflows in a Triage Agent demo.

likely_channels_and_use_cases.why_common: Admissions inboxes, faculty forwards, and application/document follow-ups remain primary in higher ed.
Request-information and program page forms capture top-of-funnel leads and free-text questions.
Conversational RFI/live chat captures high-intent questions before form abandonment.
Institutions often use text after consent for fast follow-up and re-engagement.
Useful for international prospects and time-zone-friendly asynchronous follow-up (institution dependent).
Call queues/voicemails still capture urgent or complex questions after hours.
Parents and prospects sometimes ask quick admissions questions via Facebook/Instagram DMs from ads/posts.

audience_objectives.objective: Finish a degree while balancing work/family; minimize friction and uncertainty.
key_questions: Can I start soon and study part-time?
Will my old credits transfer?
How much will this cost and what aid is available?
Who can guide me step-by-step?

audience_objectives.objective: Estimate remaining time-to-degree and get fast clarity on transfer credit value.
key_questions: How does transfer credit work?
How long does evaluation take?
Can you review missing equivalencies?
What is the next start date after my credits are reviewed?

audience_objectives.objective: Understand admissions steps, affordability, and campus/online options.
key_questions: What are the admissions requirements?
Are there scholarships?
Can parents join calls/visits?
What support is available for first-year students?

audience_objectives.objective: Support student decision-making without violating privacy boundaries.
key_questions: Who can we speak with about admissions timelines and cost?
Can we join a call or campus visit?
What can be shared if the student is over 18?
How do we route student-specific questions appropriately?

audience_objectives.objective: Combine military education benefits + prior learning/transfer credits with a clear admissions path.
key_questions: Who handles military admissions?
How do benefits and transfer credits work together?
How fast can I start while transitioning?

audience_objectives.objective: Clarify document/credential requirements and get accurate country-specific guidance.
key_questions: What documents are accepted?
What if transcripts are not in English?
Who can answer country-specific requirements?
Can I use WhatsApp or email for follow-up?

field_catalog.description: Unique inbound event/message identifier for replay, audit, and CRM dedupe.
Conversation/thread grouping key (email thread, chat session, SMS/WhatsApp thread).
Inbound timestamp in UTC for SLA tracking and after-hours routing.
Inbound channel (email, WhatsApp, web chat, web form, SMS, voicemail, social DM).
Provider, entry point, attachments, local-hour guess, and channel-specific telemetry (web activity / ASR confidence).
Observed contact identifiers and relationship context as captured from the channel (often incomplete/messy).
Entity matching outcome into a unified lead profile (new/matched/possible duplicate + confidence).
Audience segment, student type, stage, program/modality/term interest, campaign attribution, callback preferences.
Original inbound text + normalized summary, language, sentiment, urgency signals, and messiness flags.
Triage-extracted facts (program, term, transfer credits, military benefit, scam channel, etc.).
Intent/category classification, routing queue, priority, SLA, tags, high-intent score, and CRM actions.
Auto-generated personalized reply draft (or acknowledgment+handoff) plus confidence, citations, guardrails, and send readiness.
Human-handoff instructions: queue, reason, specific action, handoff summary, and pass-along context for staff.
Risk flags (FERPA/privacy, sensitive health info, financial/scam risk, redaction requirements).

notes: Distribution is intentionally uneven to reflect real-world demand (admissions/aid/transfer dominate).
A meaningful minority of records require human handoff due to privacy, account-specific, security, or specialist review constraints.
Web form/chat records include telemetry to demonstrate omnichannel identity resolution and conversion triage.
